alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Goochland; Powhatan; Western Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Louisa, northeastern Cumberland, Goochland, west central Hanover, central Powhatan and southeastern Fluvanna Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 800 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hadensville to near Fife to near Duncan. Movement was east southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Powhatan, Goochland, Hadensville, Cartersville, Fork Union, Tuckahoe, Columbia, Gum Spring, Fife, Oilville, Manakin, Trenholm, Lakeside Village, Sabot, Duncan, Wyndham, Orchid, Crozier, Rock Castle and Vontay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Goochland; Powhatan; Western Hanover
